channel.title: "Error Connectiing to server" problem
channel.description: I have been this "Error connecting to server" problem for about a week now and I can't seem to find how to fix it. My server,ritzscape, is a delta base server. The server works perfectly with 300 average people for about an hour or less. But after 1 hour or so with over 340+ players online, the server won't let anyone log in. We get the "Error connecting to server". People that are already logged in does not get disconnected and has no lag. When they log out, they can't log in to the server also. Anyone know how to fix this problem?

item.title: "Error Connectiing to server" problem
item.dc:creator: @ssolidd ssolidd
item.description:
@ssolidd wrote:

[quote=“king gauge, post:13, topic:292150”][quote author=epicmike link=topic=386002.msg2894039#msg2894039 date=1249088530]

If I do that I will lose people. I have 300 daily and resetting it every hour will get a lot of people annoyed. Specially pk-ers.

You could send an alert saying Server restarting in 10… Its for your own good.
lol
[/quote]

lol he is correct (epic) if they are dedicated as much as you are, then they would keep on playing, dispite the fact that they will have to restart every hour.[/quote]
But it is still annoying. You always have to be aware of time. That kinda kills the game.
That’s not a very good fix. Anyways, does anyone know another fix for this problem?

P.S When I said my server was dedicated, I meant the server is hosted by a dedicated online server.

Read full topic

item.title: "Error Connectiing to server" problem
item.dc:creator: @Fireweaver0 Fireweaver0
item.description:
@Fireweaver0 wrote:

[quote=“Envion, post:3, topic:292150”]The more you learn, the more you know, the more you know, and the more you forget. The more you forget, the less you know. So why bother?

We lose something like 80% of what we learn on a given day.

We’ll give knowledge points. Currently, we have 10,000 points.

If we learn 10 points, we forget 8 points. That’s still a gain of 2 points. Similarly, if we learn 100 points, we lose 80 but gain 20.

With this proof we can see that unless the rate of forgotten points exceeds 100, we will still gain points each day. :D[/quote]
Ah, but the points we gain will eventually be lost due to gaining more points.
Also what if someone learns nothing that day?

Also if you did indeed forget something you truly wanted to learn you would try to grasp it again.
In which case you would be trying to learn a point already forgot, due to learning more, and this process repeats and repeats. Unless of-course you are inhuman and retain every single piece of information like a sponge. If that’s the case you are a FREAK.

@ssolid
I’m not sure what the problem is, your specs look fine. Could there be a player limit on your server?

Read full topic

item.title: "Error Connectiing to server" problem
item.dc:creator: @ssolidd ssolidd
item.description:
@ssolidd wrote:

[quote=“Fireweaver0, post:2, topic:292150”]Maybe your pc just can’t handle that many?
Whats your computer specs?[/quote] It’s a dedicated server.

os_type Windows
os_flavor enterprise 64 bit
os_version 2003
equip_cpu_type Intel Xeon
equip_cpu_speed Nahalem 2.0
equip_mem 6 GB
equip_mem_type DDR3
equip_hard1_size 500
equip_hard1_bus sATA

It’s a DUAL Nehalem Quad-Core E5504 2.0 Ghz, I doubt that it is slow.

Read full topic

The more you learn, the more you know, the more you know, and the more you forget. The more you forget, the less you know. So why bother?

We lose something like 80% of what we learn on a given day.

We’ll give knowledge points. Currently, we have 10,000 points.

If we learn 10 points, we forget 8 points. That’s still a gain of 2 points. Similarly, if we learn 100 points, we lose 80 but gain 20.

With this proof we can see that unless the rate of forgotten points exceeds 100, we will still gain points each day.
